welcome.name: Combat Tracker Groups
welcome.author: By Arcanist
welcome.site: Visit my Website for more info:

groupSkipping.hint: Skip over each whole group of Combatants at once
groupSkipping.name: Group Skipping

openToggles.name: Open Toggles
openToggles.hint: Automatically open the toggle for the current group

rollGroupInitiative.name: Roll Group Initiative
rollGroupInitiative.hint: When pressed down, clicking on any of the initiative rolling buttons in the Combat Tracker will result in a Group Initiative roll.

sortCombatants.name: Sort Combatants
sortCombatants.hint: Sort the combatants in the Combat Tracker in the same way as they are grouped. This will stop the tracker from jumping around when switching turns and is therefore recommended especially for users with Group Skipping enabled.

onlyShowGroupsForGM.name: Only Show Groups for GMs
onlyShowGroupsForGM.hint: When enabled, Combat Tracker groups are only created for GM users

noGroupHidden.name: Don't Group Hidden Combatants
noGroupHidden.hint: If enabled, Combatants that are hidden are not grouped

noGroupPCs.name: Don't Group Combatants Owned by Players
noGroupPCs.hint: If enabled, Combatants that are owned by players are not grouped

notifications.libWrapperRequired: libWrapper must be enabled to use the {feature} functionality.
notifications.invalidMode: Grouping not possible because {mode} is not a valid mode.
notifications.alreadyInMob: Token with ID {id} is in multiple Mob Attack Tool Mobs, but will only show up in the first created Mob when grouped in the Combat Tracker. Delete the relevant mob in the Mob Attack Tool dialog to get rid of this warning.
notifications.groupSkippingWorksBetterWithSorting: Group skipping works better with Combatant sorting enabled. See README for details.
notifications.disableMATGroupInitiative: Mob Attack Tool Group Initiative has been disabled since CTG provides the same functionality and more.
